              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0" >

The web application, data synchronisation application, user administration application and web services on a Web Server. The Android application is published on an update site.  The field users download the Android application from their Android terminal for installation.</span>

        <td style="border-top:1.0px solid #000000;border-bottom:1.0px solid #000000;border-left:1.0px solid #000000;border-right:none;padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;padding-left:7.218898px;padding-right:7.218898px;vertical-align:top;width:151.16379px">

              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0" >

                <span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10.666667px" >:</span>
              </p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0" >
                <span style="font-size:10.666667px" >The Field user has access to the application on his </span>
                <span style="font-size:10.666667px" >Android terminal in mobility situation.</span>
              </p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0;font-size:10.666667px" >He can collect the requested data through ergonomic forms. </p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0;font-size:10.666667px" >The application works in connected or disconnected mode.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0;font-size:10.666667px" >Data access privileges are managed so that the user can only access the data that he is allowed to access.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0" >
                <span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10.666667px" >Data transmission and reception</span>
                <span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10.666667px" >:</span>
              </p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0;font-size:10.666667px" >Data are automatically sent to the server at a specific frequency or on the action of the user when the terminal is connected to a communication network.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0;font-size:10.666667px" >Synchronization processes are bi-directional so that the user can transmit data but also receive and update data coming from other remote users.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
              <p class="Paragraphedeliste" style="margin-left:0;margin-right:0;text-indent:0" >
                <span style="font-size:10.666667px" >The user can filter the data so that he only gets the data that he needs from the server. </span>
              </p>
            </li>
          </ul>
